articles.author: Loren Grush
articles.title: China releases video of spacecraft orbiting Mars for Lunar New Year - The Verge
articles.description: The China National Space Administration released a video selfie of its Mars orbiter, Tianwen-1, for the Chinese Lunar New Year, showing the vehicle as it zooms around Mars with the planet in the background.
articles.content:
Ride along in the Red Planets orbit
Image: Screenshot from Tianwen-1 video on China Xianhu News
Chinas first Mars orbiter, Tianwen-1, is showing off its journey around the Red Planet in a newly rel… [+2028 chars]

articles.author: Richard Speed
articles.title: Sure, the James Webb Space Telescope is cool and all. But try making one out of Lego - The Register
articles.description: Next: How to throw it a million miles without anything falling off
articles.content: A double helping of plastic playtime this Monday as we honour the achievements of the James Webb Space Telescope by building one out of Lego and an ESA astronaut takes some Playmobil on a tour of the… [+2567 chars]

articles.author: Joel Day
articles.title: Science breakthrough: Space satellite makes 'incredible' discovery of 'deformed' planet - Daily Express
articles.description: SCIENTISTS made a huge breakthrough after a satellite found a planet outside the Solar System that had been deformed by its host star to resemble the shape of a rugby ball, obliterating the idea that all planets are spherical in shape.

articles.author: John Jones
articles.title: Massive flaming meteor lights up sky over Wales as it hurtles towards Earth - Wales Online
articles.description: The rock was also seen in England, Scotland and some parts of mainland Europe
articles.content:
A flaming meteor was spotted soaring through the sky over North Wales by stunned residents.

articles.author: James Gordon
articles.title: Cruise ship veered into Falcon 9 rocket's flightpath hazard area forcing SpaceX to stand down - Daily Mail
articles.description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket that was due to launch into space on Sunday evening was abandoned with just seconds to go. All systems were 'Go' until 34 seconds prior to launch when a 'hold' was called.
articles.content:
A planned SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket launch from Cape Canaveral was abandoned on Sunday night with just seconds to go before liftoff.  
The plug was pulled with mission control's launch director calling… [+8997 chars]

articles.author: Conor Feehly
articles.title: Birds Use Earth's Magnetic Field For 'Stop Signs' When They Migrate - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Thanks to a combination of sensing the Earth's magnetic field through vision and an in-built compass that allows them to orient themselves according to magnetic intensity, migratory birds don't have much trouble finding their way.
